title: Nuances of Elixir Releases for Phoenix Applications
description:
Deploying a phoenix application using Releases is very straightforward in most cases. However for people who are just starting off, certain steps of configuration can be a bit confusing. I’ll try to address some of those which I have encountered in my earlier days of developing and deploying Phoenix applications.
This post assumes that you already have atleast a basic Phoenix application that connects to a PostgreSQL database, and is ready to be deployed.

title: What is Distributed SQL? An Evolution of the Database
description: As organizations transition to the cloud, they eventually find that the legacy relational databases that are behind some of their most critical applications simply do not take advantage of the promise of the cloud and are difficult to scale. It is the database that is limiting the speed and effectiveness of this transition. To address this, organizations want the reliability of a tested relational data store, such as Oracle, SQL Server, Postgres, and MySQL, but with the benefits of scale and global coverage that comes with the cloud.
